title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2020, the government has an improved capacity to design, implement, monitor and coordinate policies and strategies related to multi-sectoral nutrition (MSN) interventions., which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and women in vulnerable regions demand and use high-quality and proven preventive and curative nutrition interventions, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the government has an improved capacity to design, implement, monitor and coordinate policies and strategies related tomulti-sectoral nutrition (MSN) interventions.

description.narrative: Cameroon has been a Scaling-Up Nutrition (SUN) country since 2013 and has progressively put in place the governance tools necessary to structure the sector. Particular emphasis has been placed on multisectoral coordination through the Inter-Ministerial Committee for the Fight against Malnutrition. These efforts bore fruit in 2021, including through commitments made by Cameroon at the Tokyo Nutrition for Growth summit.To strengthen local ownership and leverage the administrative decentralization process in Cameroon, UNICEF has supported local authorities to integrate nutrition into their local development plans and allocate financial resources to nutrition activities. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
